data.title: Common Elements
data.solution:
# Read input
array1 = list(map(int, input().split()))
array2 = list(map(int, input().split()))

# Find the common elements
common_elements = sorted(set(array1) & set(array2))

# Output the result
if common_elements:
    print(" ".join(map(str, common_elements)))
else:
    print("none")
data.statement: Given two arrays of integers, your task is to find the common elements between the two arrays and print them in ascending order. If there are no common elements, print {{none}}
data.constraints:
Each array contains at most 10 integers, all distinct.
The integers are between  -100 and 100
data.stubGenerator:
read arr1:string(256)
read arr2:string(256)
write answer
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> A space-separated list of integers, representing the first array.
<<Line 2:>> A space-separated list of integers, representing the second array.
data.outputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> A space-separated list of integers representing the common elements between the two arrays, sorted in ascending order.
If there are no common elements, print {{none}} .

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Given two arrays of integers, your task is to find the common elements between the two arrays and print them in ascending order. If there are no common elements, print none
Input
Line 1: A space-separated list of integers, representing the first array.
Line 2: A space-separated list of integers, representing the second array.
Output
Line 1: A space-separated list of integers representing the common elements between the two arrays, sorted in ascending order.
If there are no common elements, print none .
Constraints
Each array contains at most 10 integers, all distinct.
The integers are between -100 and 100
Example
Input
1 2 3 4
3 6 4 8
Output
3 4
